Republicans claim the Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act is radical. Let's talk about what this bill does:
 
‚úîÔ∏èrequire early voting & vote by mail options
‚úîÔ∏èmake Election Day a holiday
‚úîÔ∏ècrack down on voter intimidation
‚úîÔ∏èrequire post-election audits
 
How is any of this radical?

Before Trump, Republicans at least pretended their laws weren‚Äôt blatantly discriminatory.
 
Now they don't even try to hide the fact that they're making it incredibly difficult for people of color, elderly individuals, students, working families, & people w/ disabilities to vote.

Republicans are passing bills to close polling locations, limit voting hours, remove drop-boxes, and even make it illegal to hand a voter in line a bottle of water.  
 
I truly want to know how you can even pretend to justify that law? This is voter suppression plain and simple.
